page.title: 14EDUCATION
page.content: The survey area includes the William Brookes School, an 11-18 rural comprehensive serving a catchment area bounded in the N.& E. by the R.Severn; in S. by Clee Hills;and W. by Cardington Hills. Pupils comefrom 10 junior schools in 80 plus square miles. Each day 14 53 seat coaches bring them for 8.50am.& return at 3.40 School opened 1970 based on Secondary Modern built 1953. In 1980 almost 1000 pupils but declining birth rate 780 pupils & 52 staff 1985.By 1991 629 pupils and 40 staff. School has broad based curriculum, progressive teaching & featured 1974 in Min.Ed. publication "10 Good Schools". School named after local doctor- Dr William Penney Brookes(Q.V.) who did much to educate, modernise & improve 19th. century Much Wenlock.
